title: 111_s3922
content:
The "Furthering International Nuclear Safety Act of 2010" aims to enhance international nuclear safety cooperation, support the Convention on Nuclear Safety, improve nuclear safety for countries with civilian nuclear power programs, and increase public access to nuclear safety information. The "Furthering International Nuclear Safety Act of 2010" defines "appropriate congressional committees" as specific committees in the Senate and House of Representatives and "Convention" as the Convention on Nuclear Safety ratified by the United States in 1999. The "Furthering International Nuclear Safety Act of 2010" defines key terms related to the Convention on Nuclear Safety ratified by the United States in 1999, including terms like "meeting," "national report," "party," and "summary report." The "Furthering International Nuclear Safety Act of 2010" defines key terms related to the Convention on Nuclear Safety ratified by the United States in 1999. The President shall direct the US delegate to the Convention on Nuclear Safety to use their voice, vote, and influence to encourage parties to assess safety progress, increase public availability of national reports, and enhance dissemination of answers to questions raised by other parties. The IAEA supports the Convention on Nuclear Safety by providing assistance to parties preparing national reports, offering additional support for meetings, and improving the safety of civilian nuclear power programs. All countries with or considering civilian nuclear power programs are encouraged to formally join the Convention. SEC. 5. STRATEGIC PLAN.

Within 180 days of this Act's enactment, the Secretary of State, with other relevant US agencies, will develop and submit the US Government's strategic plan for international nuclear safety cooperation for operating power reactors to congressional committees.

SEC. 6. REPORTS. Within 180 days of this Act's enactment, reports must be submitted to congressional committees detailing the status of implementing the strategic plan and achieving goals, as well as the status of achieving actions set forth in section 4.
